result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert Earl Lybert Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Conceal (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(d).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Sentence withheld, placed on one year probation.  Conditions of probation:  Fine and costs totalling $589.00.   Pay restitution to Walmart of $40.71.     Complete any counseling deemed appropriate by agent. Report to probation today.

miscConds.notes: $389 fine.    If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

$40.71 restitution to Walmart plus surcharges.    If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

$200 DNA surcharge.    If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Complete any counseling deemed appropriate by agent

Defendant Robert Earl Lybert in court with attorney Sheila M. Yohnk.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 DE advised of rights and penalties; DE waives rights; parties stipulate to facts.  DEF pleads No Contest to Ct #1.  Found Guilty.  Sentence withheld, placed on one year probation.  Conditions of probation:  Fine and costs totalling $589.00.   Pay restitution to Walmart of $40.71.     Complete any counseling deemed appropriate by agent. Report to probation today.

Victim notification completed as per DA.

Defendant Robert Earl Lybert in court, in custody.  Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls case and recites appearances.  Defendant has rec'd copy of complaint and would like to enter NC plea.  Court advised him what a no contest plea meant.  Defendant requests time to obtain an attorney.  Court entered NG plea.  State requests bail be set at $1000.00 signature.  Court sets bail.  Status conference scheduled for December 15, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
